definitions: ridge of water moving across a surface caused by wind or disturbance
movement of hand or arm as greeting or signal
curving shape or pattern resembling water movement
periodic disturbance traveling through medium carrying energy without matter transport
sudden increase or occurrence of similar things in succession
examples: The surfer rode a massive wave to the shore successfully
Ocean waves crashed against the rocky cliffs throughout the storm
She gave a friendly wave from across the crowded room
The queen's wave from the balcony delighted the waiting crowds
Her hair fell in beautiful waves down her shoulders
The fabric's wave pattern created an elegant visual effect
Sound waves travel through air at approximately 343 meters per second
The electromagnetic wave spectrum includes visible light and radio frequencies
A wave of protests swept across the nation last month
The hospital experienced a wave of flu cases this winter

definitions: distance between successive crests of a wave especially in electromagnetic radiation
level of understanding or communication compatibility between people sharing similar thoughts
examples: Red light has a longer wavelength than blue light radiation
Radio stations broadcast at specific wavelengths to avoid interference
We're definitely on the same wavelength about this project
The team members weren't on the same wavelength during negotiations

definitions: act of moving hand or arm back and forth as signal
continuous back and forth or undulating motion of objects
examples: The waving of flags marked the start of the ceremony
Her constant waving finally caught the taxi driver's attention
The waving of wheat fields in the wind was mesmerizing
The waving of tree branches warned of the approaching storm

definitions: solid substance from bees or petroleum used for sealing and waterproofing
preparation used for polishing and protecting surfaces like floors or cars
yellowish substance secreted in ear canal for protection and cleaning
gradual increase in moon's visible illuminated portion before full moon
examples: The letter was sealed with red wax bearing the family crest
Candles are traditionally made from beeswax or paraffin wax
He applied car wax to protect the paint from weather damage
The floor wax made the hardwood shine like new
The doctor removed excess ear wax during the examination
Ear wax naturally protects the ear canal from dust and bacteria
The moon will wax until reaching fullness next Tuesday night
Sailors knew the wax and wane of lunar cycles intimately

definitions: cosmetic hair removal process using heated wax strips or applications
process of applying wax to surfaces for protection or shine
period when moon appears to grow larger night after night
examples: She scheduled a waxing appointment at the salon next week
Leg waxing provides longer-lasting results than shaving
The waxing of the floors took the janitor several hours
Regular waxing keeps the car's paint looking brand new
The waxing moon will be full by Friday evening
Ancient farmers planted crops during the moon's waxing phase

definitions: side or edge of a road or path especially in rural areas
examples: Wildflowers grew along the wayside throughout the countryside journey
The tired travelers rested at a wayside inn for refreshment

definitions: process of becoming less strong physically or structurally over time
gradual decline in economic indicators or market performance
examples: The weakening of the bridge's supports concerned the engineers greatly
Doctors monitored the patient's weakening condition throughout the night
The weakening of the currency affected international trade significantly
Market analysts predicted further weakening of consumer confidence this quarter

definitions: large amount of money, property, and valuable possessions owned by someone
abundant supply or profusion of a particular desirable thing or quality
examples: His wealth came from successful technology investments over decades
The family's wealth has been preserved through generations of management
The region possesses a wealth of natural resources awaiting development
She brought a wealth of experience to her new position

definitions: process of gradually stopping breastfeeding or bottle feeding an infant
gradual withdrawal from dependence on something previously relied upon
examples: The pediatrician recommended starting weaning at six months old
Weaning should be a gradual process for both mother and baby
The company began weaning itself off government subsidies last year
Weaning patients off pain medication requires careful medical supervision

definitions: instrument or device designed for inflicting harm or damage in combat
means used to gain advantage or defend against opposition in conflict
examples: The soldier cleaned his weapon before the morning inspection
Ancient weapons are displayed in the museum's medieval collection
Information became their most powerful weapon in the legal battle
Her sharp wit was her best weapon in debates

definitions: collective term for weapons and military equipment considered as a group
examples: The army's modern weaponry includes drones and precision missiles
Medieval weaponry required different combat strategies than today's technology

definitions: act of having clothes, jewelry, or accessories on one's body
damage or deterioration caused by continuous use or friction
particular way of wearing or styling clothing or accessories
examples: Daily wear of the uniform is required for all students
The wear of protective gear prevented serious injuries
The carpet showed significant wear after years of foot traffic
Tire wear can indicate alignment problems with your vehicle
Business wear has become more casual in recent years
Evening wear for the gala must be formal attire

definitions: electronic device designed to be worn on the body for tracking or communication
item of clothing or accessory suitable for wearing in specific contexts
examples: The fitness wearable tracked her steps and heart rate continuously
New wearables can monitor blood sugar levels without needles
The designer created wearables that transition from day to evening
These wearables combine fashion with sustainable materials

definitions: person who wears or is wearing something specific
examples: The mask protects the wearer from airborne particles effectively
Contact lenses should be comfortable for the wearer throughout the day

definitions: causing fatigue or exhaustion through continuous stress or demands
act or state of having clothing or accessories on one's body
examples: The constant criticism was wearing on her mental health
Long shifts at the hospital were wearing for all staff
The wearing of masks became mandatory in public spaces
Wearing appropriate safety equipment is required on construction sites

definitions: small carnivorous mammal with long slender body and short legs
person who behaves dishonestly or avoids responsibility through cunning
examples: The weasel hunted mice in the barn throughout winter
Weasels can squeeze through incredibly small openings
Don't trust him; he's a weasel who never keeps promises
The politician was called a weasel for avoiding direct answers

definitions: state of atmosphere including temperature, wind, rain, and other meteorological elements
period of difficulty or hardship that must be endured
examples: The weather forecast predicts rain for the entire weekend
Severe weather warnings were issued for the coastal regions
The company managed to weather the economic recession successfully
Their marriage weathered many storms over the years

definitions: male television or radio presenter who reports and predicts weather conditions
examples: The weatherman predicted sunshine for the holiday weekend
Local weatherman became famous for his accurate storm predictions

definitions: device mounted on buildings showing wind direction often decoratively shaped
examples: The rooster weathervane spun wildly during the storm
The old barn's weathervane had pointed north for decades

definitions: pattern or method of interlacing threads to create fabric
technique of combining elements into a complex whole
zigzag movement pattern especially when avoiding obstacles
examples: The basket's weave was tight enough to hold water
This fabric has a distinctive herringbone weave pattern
The author's weave of subplots created a rich narrative
The weave of different musical styles made the album unique
The boxer's weave helped him avoid his opponent's punches
The drunk driver's weave alerted police to pull him over

definitions: person who weaves fabric or baskets professionally or as craft
small tropical bird that builds elaborate woven nests from grass
examples: The weaver demonstrated traditional techniques at the craft fair
Master weavers can create incredibly complex patterns by hand
The weaver bird's nest hung from the acacia tree branch
Male weavers build multiple nests to attract potential mates

definitions: craft or process of creating fabric by interlacing threads on loom
process of combining various elements into unified whole
side to side movement especially when walking unsteadily
examples: Weaving has been practiced for thousands of years worldwide
The weaving of silk requires exceptional skill and patience
The weaving of multiple storylines kept readers engaged throughout
Her weaving of fact and fiction created a compelling documentary
His weaving walk suggested he had consumed too much alcohol
The car's weaving between lanes concerned other drivers greatly

definitions: silk structure spun by spiders to catch prey
system of interconnected documents and resources on the internet
complex system of interconnected elements or relationships
thin membrane between fingers or toes in some animals
examples: The spider's web glistened with morning dew drops
A web stretched across the garden path overnight
She found the information on the web within minutes
The company's web presence increased sales significantly
A web of lies eventually trapped the corrupt politician
The investigation revealed a web of criminal connections
The duck's webbed feet help it swim efficiently
The web between his fingers was a rare birth condition

definitions: strong woven fabric strip used for straps, belts, and support
membrane connecting toes or fingers in aquatic animals
examples: The climber checked the webbing on his harness before ascending
Nylon webbing is commonly used in military equipment
The frog's webbing allows it to swim quickly through water
Webbing between toes helps aquatic birds paddle efficiently

definitions: digital video camera connected to computer for broadcasting images over internet
examples: The webcam allowed them to video chat with overseas family
Security webcams monitored the building entrance continuously

definitions: person responsible for maintaining and managing a website's technical aspects
examples: The webmaster updated the site's security protocols monthly
Contact the webmaster if you experience any technical difficulties

definitions: single document on the internet accessible through a web browser
examples: The webpage loaded slowly due to heavy traffic
She bookmarked the webpage for future reference

definitions: collection of related web pages under single domain name on internet
examples: The company's website receives millions of visitors monthly
She designed websites for small businesses as freelance work

definitions: ceremony where two people are united in marriage with celebrations
examples: Their wedding took place in a beautiful garden setting
The wedding reception lasted until early morning hours

definitions: piece of wood or metal having thick end tapering to thin edge
golf club with angled face for lifting ball high
shoe or heel that is thick at back tapering to front
something that causes division or separation between people
examples: He used a wedge to split the log into firewood
A wedge of cheese was served with crackers
The golfer selected a sand wedge for the bunker shot
His wedge shot landed perfectly on the green
She wore wedge sandals to the beach party
Wedge heels are more comfortable than stilettos
The issue drove a wedge between the two old friends
Political differences created a wedge in their relationship

definitions: state of being married considered as legal and social institution
examples: Children born out of wedlock faced social stigma historically
They entered into wedlock after ten years of dating

definitions: informal term for act of urinating especially used with children
very small amount or size particularly in Scottish usage
examples: The toddler needed a wee before the long car journey
The puppy had a wee on the kitchen floor
Just a wee bit of sugar in my tea please
We'll stay for a wee while longer

definitions: plant growing where it is not wanted competing with cultivated plants
informal term for marijuana or cannabis used as drug
weak or unimpressive person especially physically slight
examples: Dandelions are considered weeds in most lawn gardens
She spent hours pulling weeds from the flower beds
The police found weed in the suspect's car
Some states have legalized weed for medical use
The bully called him a weed because of his size
Don't be such a weed; stand up for yourself

definitions: period of seven consecutive days starting from Sunday or Monday
examples: She works five days a week at the office
Next week we're going on vacation to Hawaii

definitions: any day from Monday through Friday when people typically work
examples: The museum offers discounted admission on weekdays
Traffic is always heavier on weekdays than weekends

definitions: period from Friday evening through Sunday evening for rest and recreation
examples: They spent the weekend at their lake house
Weekend traffic to the beach was particularly heavy

definitions: person who spends weekends away from their main residence
small suitcase or bag suitable for weekend trips
examples: The beach town fills with weekenders during summer months
Weekenders from the city bought up most coastal properties
She packed her weekender for the two-day business trip
This weekender bag fits perfectly in overhead compartments

definitions: magazine or newspaper published once every week
occurring or done once a week or every week
examples: She subscribes to several fashion weeklies
The local weekly covers community news and events
Weekly meetings keep the team aligned on project goals
He makes weekly visits to his elderly mother

definitions: evening of a weekday typically Sunday through Thursday nights
examples: They rarely go out on weeknights due to work
Weeknight dinners are usually quick and simple meals

definitions: act of shedding tears especially from sadness or grief
having drooping branches like certain trees or plants
examples: The weeping of mourners filled the funeral chapel
Her weeping continued long after the sad news
The weeping willow provided shade by the pond
Weeping cherry trees bloom beautifully in spring

definitions: small beetle with elongated snout that damages stored grain and crops
examples: Weevils infested the stored rice in the pantry
Cotton weevils devastated crops in the southern states

definitions: process of determining weight or mass using a scale
careful consideration of options or factors before deciding
examples: The weighing of ingredients must be precise for baking
Daily weighing helps track weight loss progress accurately
The jury spent hours weighing the evidence presented
She's still weighing her options for graduate school

definitions: measurement of how heavy something is due to gravitational force
heavy object used for exercise or to hold something down
relative importance or influence of something in a decision
oppressive feeling of responsibility or worry
examples: The package's weight exceeded the postal service limit
She lost weight through diet and exercise
He lifted weights at the gym every morning
Paper weights kept documents from blowing away
Your opinion carries significant weight in this decision
The weight of evidence supports the prosecution's case
The weight of responsibility was overwhelming for him
She felt the weight of expectations from her family

definitions: statistical method of adjusting values to reflect relative importance
additional payment to salary reflecting cost of living or responsibilities
examples: The weighting of survey responses ensured demographic representation
Statistical weighting corrected for sampling bias in the study
London weighting compensates for higher living costs
The position includes a weighting for management responsibilities

definitions: athlete who competes in lifting heavy weights in specific techniques
examples: The Olympic weightlifter trained six days a week
Professional weightlifters follow strict nutrition and training programs

definitions: sport involving lifting heavy weights in competition or for exercise
examples: Olympic weightlifting includes the snatch and clean-and-jerk events
She took up weightlifting to improve her overall fitness

definitions: greeting or reception given to someone arriving at a place
invitation or permission to enter or participate freely
examples: The warm welcome made visitors feel immediately comfortable
They received a hero's welcome upon returning home
Everyone is welcome to attend the community meeting
Your suggestions are always welcome here

definitions: joint formed by fusing metal pieces together using heat
examples: The weld held strong despite years of stress
Inspectors checked every weld on the bridge structure

definitions: person whose job involves joining metal parts using welding equipment
examples: The welder wore protective gear while working
Certified welders are in high demand for construction projects

definitions: process of joining metal parts by heating and fusing them together
examples: Welding requires proper safety equipment and training
Underwater welding is one of the most dangerous professions
